definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
to chant/to recite rhythmically/to polish verse
lit. singing of the wind and the moon; fig. vacuous and sentimental (of poetry or art)

sentences.english: No reason for disgust, she intones, no cause for condemnation.
sentences.chinese: 她咏吟道，没必要去厌恶，没理由去责难。

sentences.english: It's a holy ceremony, it's done just like this in front of chanting priests.
sentences.chinese: 这是神圣的仪式，在吟颂咒咒文的法师跟前就这样做。

sentences.english: And He'll give you a new, sweet song.
sentences.chinese: 他会教你一首新的咏吟。

sentences.english: Because last night I heard moan from the antique shop.
sentences.chinese: 因为昨天晚上我听到隔壁传来呻囘吟声。

sentences.english: It's a holy cerony, it's done just like this in front of chanting priests.
sentences.chinese: 这是神圣的仪式，在吟颂咒咒文的法师跟前就这样做。

sentences.english: I never read poetry to him again.
sentences.chinese: 我再也没有给他吟过诗。

sentences.english: In the chapel you can listen to the nuns chanting their prayers.
sentences.chinese: 礼拜堂里，你会听到修女们吟颂着祷文。

definition: to chant/to recite rhythmically/to polish verse
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
late at night/in the dead of night
to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
(literary) to end/to stop/one of the stanzas (usually two) of a ci poem 詞|词[ci2]/classifier for songs or ci poems
to recall with emotion/to feel sentiments
